Comment: That's really quite inaccurate. The administration has complied almost every time by releasing funds or reinstating workers. It's just no one pays attention to the resolution that comes weeks or months after the fact - it doesn't make the news. There are only a handful where the administration isn't complying (yet). But even there they've typically had some kind of legal gymnastics to justify their refusal, even if it's a bad faith argument. Or the case is still going through appeals. The perception that the admin is defying the courts is what they WANT you think. Because if you believe they are already doing it, there won't be spontaneous outcry when they actually, eventually DO.
